issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
status.name: Open

fields.description:
*Assessment*

Bucket versioning has been supported in Eucalyptus for a few releases now, however we haven't documented it.  This is a request to add documentation regarding how to use [bucket versioning|http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/Versioning.html] in Eucalyptus 4.2.0.

*Write-Up*

[Versioning|http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/Versioning.html] is supported in Eucalyptus.  Versioning gives a cloud user the ability to store multiple versions of an object in a bucket.  This provides the added capability of preserving, retrieving, and restoring every version of every object stored in a Eucalyptus OSG bucket.  A couple of things to note about versioning:

* Once versioning has been enabled on a bucket, the only way to remove versioning is do the following:
** [Suspend versioning|http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/VersionSuspendedBehavior.html] on the bucket
** Delete all the objects (this includes [Delete Markers|http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/DeleteMarker.html])
** Delete the bucket.  
** Recreate the bucket with the same name.
* Whenever an object is created in a bucket where versioning is enabled, there are two copies of that object stored.  Please keep this in mind due to possible bucket quotas being applied on the user and/or account. 

Currently,  Eucalyptus OSG versioning interaction is supported by the following metods:

* third-party tools (e.g. AWS CLI)
* [AWS SDKs|https://aws.amazon.com/tools/], and other SDK libraries (e.g. [python boto|https://boto.readthedocs.org/en/latest/])

[AWS CLI|http://docs.aws.amazon.com/cli/latest/userguide/cli-chap-welcome.html] will be used to demonstrate this feature in the examples below.  Make sure and complete the following AWS CLI documentation sections before walking through the examples below:

* [Installing the AWS Command Line Interface|http://docs.aws.amazon.com/cli/latest/userguide/installing.html]
* [Configuring the AWS Command Line Interface|http://docs.aws.amazon.com/cli/latest/userguide/cli-chap-getting-started.html]

*Enable Versioning*

To enable versioning on a bucket, utilize the {{--version-configuration}} option in the {{[aws s3api put-bucket-versioning|http://docs.aws.amazon.com/cli/latest/reference/s3api/put-bucket-versioning.html]}} call:
{code}
# aws --endpoint-url http://s3.c-06.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/ s3api put-bucket-versioning --bucket devops-misc --versioning-configuration Status=Enabled --profile devops-admin

# aws --endpoint-url http://s3.c-06.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/ s3api get-bucket-versioning --bucket devops-misc --profile devops-admin
{
    "Status": "Enabled"
}
{code}
Once enabled, any objects added to the bucket, versioning will be applied.

*Listing Object Versions*

To see the object versions, use the {{[aws s3api list-object-versions|http://docs.aws.amazon.com/cli/latest/reference/s3api/list-object-versions.html]}} call.  In the example below, the object has been uploaded twice.  Even though there is only one object in the bucket, the {{list-object-versions}} call will show all the versions of that object:
{code}
[Uploading the object]
# aws --endpoint-url http://s3.c-06.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/ s3 cp mytasks.json s3://devops-misc/mytasks.json --profile devops-admin
upload: ./mytasks.json to s3://devops-misc/mytasks.json
# aws --endpoint-url http://s3.c-06.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/ s3 cp mytasks.json s3://devops-misc/mytasks.json --profile devops-admin
upload: ./mytasks.json to s3://devops-misc/mytasks.json

[Listing bucket objects]
# aws --endpoint-url http://s3.c-06.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/ s3 ls s3://devops-misc --profile devops-admin
# 2015-11-18 07:42:24       1995 mytasks.json

[Listing object versions]
# aws --endpoint-url http://s3.c-06.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/ s3api list-object-versions --bucket devops-misc --profile devops-admin
{
    "Versions": [
        {
            "LastModified": "2015-11-18T15:42:24.206Z",
            "VersionId": "994fb93bca29443bad97b9b07a90c620",
            "ETag": "\"463ca5657acc3ebe5e0c0480e83f5110\"",
            "StorageClass": "STANDARD",
            "Key": "mytasks.json",
            "Owner": {
                "DisplayName": "development-operations",
                "ID": "5d1a3513a9232c1442491ba291142572f4326c4334b102d1c58544d3e49b3b22"
            },
            "IsLatest": true,
            "Size": 1995
        },
        {
            "LastModified": "2015-11-18T15:42:16.333Z",
            "VersionId": "81b359a1facd495fad656b9fce55a8cf",
            "ETag": "\"463ca5657acc3ebe5e0c0480e83f5110\"",
            "StorageClass": "STANDARD",
            "Key": "mytasks.json",
            "Owner": {
                "DisplayName": "development-operations",
                "ID": "5d1a3513a9232c1442491ba291142572f4326c4334b102d1c58544d3e49b3b22"
            },
            "IsLatest": false,
            "Size": 1995
        }
    ]
}
{code}

*Deleting the object - Delete Markers*

This example demonstrates how even though the object has been deleted, its still present in the bucket.  The [delete marker|http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/DeleteMarker.html] acts as a placeholder and marks the object deleted.  Eucalyptus OSG thinks the object has been deleted, but in reality, it hasn't.
{code}
[Delete the object]
# aws --endpoint-url http://s3.c-06.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/ s3 rm s3://devops-misc/mytasks.json --profile devops-admin
delete: s3://devops-misc/mytasks.json

[List bucket contents]
# aws --endpoint-url http://s3.c-06.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/ s3 ls s3://devops-misc --profile devops-admin
#

[List object versions]
# aws --endpoint-url http://s3.c-06.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/ s3api list-object-versions --bucket devops-misc --profile devops-admin
{
    "DeleteMarkers": [
        {
            "Owner": {
                "DisplayName": "development-operations",
                "ID": "5d1a3513a9232c1442491ba291142572f4326c4334b102d1c58544d3e49b3b22"
            },
            "IsLatest": true,
            "VersionId": "06c33102e95147688a2e9587d0ca9f94",
            "Key": "mytasks.json",
            "LastModified": "2015-11-18T15:46:08.839Z"
        }
    ],
    "Versions": [
        {
            "LastModified": "2015-11-18T15:42:24.206Z",
            "VersionId": "994fb93bca29443bad97b9b07a90c620",
            "ETag": "\"463ca5657acc3ebe5e0c0480e83f5110\"",
            "StorageClass": "STANDARD",
            "Key": "mytasks.json",
            "Owner": {
                "DisplayName": "development-operations",
                "ID": "5d1a3513a9232c1442491ba291142572f4326c4334b102d1c58544d3e49b3b22"
            },
            "IsLatest": false,
            "Size": 1995
        },
        {
            "LastModified": "2015-11-18T15:42:16.333Z",
            "VersionId": "81b359a1facd495fad656b9fce55a8cf",
            "ETag": "\"463ca5657acc3ebe5e0c0480e83f5110\"",
            "StorageClass": "STANDARD",
            "Key": "mytasks.json",
            "Owner": {
                "DisplayName": "development-operations",
                "ID": "5d1a3513a9232c1442491ba291142572f4326c4334b102d1c58544d3e49b3b22"
            },
            "IsLatest": false,
            "Size": 1995
        }
    ]
}
{code}

*Restoring the object*

To restore the object, [remove the delete marker|http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/dev/RemDelMarker.html] using the {{[aws s3api delete-object|http://docs.aws.amazon.com/cli/latest/reference/s3api/delete-object.html]}} call.  Make sure and pass the {{--version-id}} associated with the delete marker object.
{code}
[Delete the delete marker object]
# aws --endpoint-url http://s3.c-06.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/ s3api delete-object --bucket devops-misc --key mytasks.json --version-id "06c33102e95147688a2e9587d0ca9f94" --profile devops-admin
{
    "VersionId": "06c33102e95147688a2e9587d0ca9f94",
    "DeleteMarker": true
}

[List object versions]
# aws --endpoint-url http://s3.c-06.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/ s3api list-object-versions --bucket devops-misc --profile devops-admin
{
    "Versions": [
        {
            "LastModified": "2015-11-18T15:42:24.206Z",
            "VersionId": "994fb93bca29443bad97b9b07a90c620",
            "ETag": "\"463ca5657acc3ebe5e0c0480e83f5110\"",
            "StorageClass": "STANDARD",
            "Key": "mytasks.json",
            "Owner": {
                "DisplayName": "development-operations",
                "ID": "5d1a3513a9232c1442491ba291142572f4326c4334b102d1c58544d3e49b3b22"
            },
            "IsLatest": true,
            "Size": 1995
        },
        {
            "LastModified": "2015-11-18T15:42:16.333Z",
            "VersionId": "81b359a1facd495fad656b9fce55a8cf",
            "ETag": "\"463ca5657acc3ebe5e0c0480e83f5110\"",
            "StorageClass": "STANDARD",
            "Key": "mytasks.json",
            "Owner": {
                "DisplayName": "development-operations",
                "ID": "5d1a3513a9232c1442491ba291142572f4326c4334b102d1c58544d3e49b3b22"
            },
            "IsLatest": false,
            "Size": 1995
        }
    ]
}

[List objects]
# aws --endpoint-url http://s3.c-06.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/ s3 ls s3://devops-misc --profile devops-admin
2015-11-18 07:42:24       1995 mytasks.json
{code}

*Download a specific object version*

To download a specific object version, use {{[aws s3api get-object|http://docs.aws.amazon.com/cli/latest/reference/s3api/get-object.html]}}, passing the VersionID of the object using the {{--version-id}} option:
{code}
[Downloading a specific object]
# aws --endpoint-url http://s3.c-06.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/ s3api get-object --bucket devops-misc --key mytasks.json --version-id "81b359a1facd495fad656b9fce55a8cf" mytasks-v2.json --profile devops-admin
{
    "ContentType": "application/octet-stream",
    "LastModified": "Wed, 18 Nov 2015 15:42:16 GMT",
    "ContentLength": 1995,
    "VersionId": "81b359a1facd495fad656b9fce55a8cf",
    "ETag": "\"463ca5657acc3ebe5e0c0480e83f5110\"",
    "Metadata": {}
}

[Listing the files in the local directory]
# ls mytasks*
mytasks.json  mytasks-v2.json
{code}
